channel.title: iDigital
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from iDigital, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: DeepMind’s SCoRe shows LLMs can use their internal knowledge to correct their mistakes
item.description: Sometimes, the LLMs have the internal knowledge to self-correct their responses. They just need the right training technique to use it.

item.title: RBR50 Spotlight: OpenAI enabling embodied AI to flourish

item.title: ‘This money is not bringing me a lot of happiness’: My husband and I have $7 million, but our kids are trouble. Should we cut them off?
item.description: “His son and his wife are not good to us. We rarely see them and they never offer to help us with anything.”

item.title: October tends to be a positive month for stocks — unless a presidential election is looming
item.description: Markets crave certainty, which can be in short supply in October when it comes before a U.S. presidential election.

item.title: Pika 1.5 launches with physics-defying AI special effects
item.description: The new Pikaffects can transform imagery and pre-recorded video subjects into bizarrely malleable versions of themselves.

item.title: Treasury yields reverse safe-haven falls as oil prices rise, U.S. dock strike continues
item.description: Treasury yields rose early Wednesday amid concerns rising energy prices and a prolonged U.S. dock strike may stoke inflation.

item.title: Inference framework Archon promises to make LLMs quicker, without additional costs
item.description: Stanford researchers presented Archon, a framework that can cut down on inference costs and allow LLMs to perform better.

item.title: From Pearl Harbor to Sept. 11, here’s how stocks typically react to the outbreak of wars
item.description: Wars, what are they good for? Not stocks, at least for 22 days.

item.title: ‘I believe she made a big mistake’: My wife put her paycheck into a bank account with her inheritance. Do I now own 50% of those funds?
item.description: “I’m still working, and we’ve always filed joint tax returns.”
